Description of incident: The company in Arkansas lost more than $110,000 this month when hackers stole the firm’s online banking credentials and drained its payroll account. On Wednesday, Apr. 7, Ft. Smith based JE Systems Inc. received a call from its bank stating that the company needed to move more money into its payroll account. Over the course of two days, someone had approved two batches of payroll payments — one for $45,000 and another for $67,000. A few days later, the First National Bank of Fort Smith sent JE Systems a letter saying the bank would not be responsible for the loss. It was their internet address that was used to process the payments, and their online banking user name and password.
